intro: Hyoscyamus pusillus, commonly known as the lesser henbane, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 20–40 centimeters and features simple, alternate leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers with five petals, which bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, brown seeds. Hyoscyamus pusillus contains toxic alkaloids and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
